intro: Reevesia pubescens var. kwangsiensis, commonly known as the Kwangsi Reevesia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The species is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
